snippet: Highlights from the International Herald Tribune archives: A flu epidemic shuts down public services in Berlin in 1889.
abstract: Highlights from the International Herald Tribune archives: A flu epidemic shuts down public services in Berlin in 1889.
lead_paragraph: BERLIN — Influenza claims Berlin for its own. The schools are gradually becoming deserted. In some, such as that founded by Queen Louisa, many teachers and half the scholars are down with it, so that it has been suggested to let the Christmas holidays begin now. The course of justice has been interrupted by the plague. Absent witnesses, ‘‘Schoeffen’’ (Associate Judges), or lawyers, plead influenza as an excuse.
